oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Martha White Grand Ole Opry - 1952-07-12
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of the Martha White Grand Ole Opry. The episode is hosted by Jud Collins. The tape features: Ernest Tubb (musician), Bill Monroe (musician), Anita Carter (musician), the Carter Family (musical group), the Crook Brothers (musical group), Hank Williams (musician), Chet Atkins (musician), and Tommy Jackson (musician). The recording is from July 12, 1952.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jud Collins; Ernest Tubb; Bill Monroe; Anita Carter; Carter Family; Crook Brothers; Hank Williams; Chet Atkins; Tommy Jackson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:03) Jud Collins introduces the Martha White Grand Ole Opry -- (00:06) Martha White Theme (Carter Sisters) -- (00:26) Collins introduces Ernest Tubb -- (00:51) Daisy May (Ernest Tubb) -- (02:34) Tubbs discusses the upcoming schedule and introduces Bill Monroe -- (03:01) Blue Moon of Kentucky (Bill Monroe) -- (04:48) Martha White Theme (Anita Carter) -- (05:05) Collins performs a Martha White radio spot -- (05:59) Martha White Theme (Anita Carter) -- (06:07) Tubb introduces the Carter Family -- (06:23) Fair and Tender Ladies (Carter Family) -- (09:18) Tubb invites everyone to square dance -- (09:31) Sallie Goodin [with square-dancing calls] (Crook Brothers) -- (11:13) Tubb introduces Anita Carter -- (11:23) Martha White Theme (Anita Carter) -- (11:43) Tubb introduces Hank Williams -- (12:08) Jambalaya (Hank Williams) -- (14:59) Beginning of part two of the tape -- (15:06) Tubb introduces Monroe and his Bluegrass Boys -- (15:27) Brakeman's Blues (Bill Monroe) -- (17:31) Tubb introduces "Somebody Stole My Honey) -- (17:44) Someone Stole My Honey (Ernest Tubb) -- (20:00) Collins performs a Martha White radio spot -- (20:58) Rainbow (Chet Atkins) -- (22:48) Tubb introduces Williams -- (23:02) Honky Tonkin' (Hank Williams) -- (25:04) Collins reveals the size of the live audience and introduces Fuller Warren -- (25:45) Give Me a Little Old Fashioned Love (Ernest Tubb) -- (27:13) Breakdown (Tommy Jackson) -- (28:00) Collins performs his outro statements -- (28:15) Biscuit Song (Carter Sisters) -- (29:10) Collins performs his outro statement about Harvey's
